title: Vase, "scenic vellum", 1909
inscribed: Artist's monogram incised on bottom, underglaze:  ETH., also, V impressed on bottom, underglaze:  RP cipher with 14 flames, IX beneath 925 B/V
dimensions: H x Diam: 32.4 x 15.2 cm (12 3/4 x 6 in.)
creditline: Gift of Marcia and William Goodman
description: White clay body, thrown.  Ovoid body with a gradual taper from shoulder to rim, thick lip; no foot.  Decorated with tall slender trees and branches.  Underbrush covering lower third of body and tree foliage filling third to lip.  Trees and foliage in dark brown underglazed slip against ivory background.  Interior is greenish-white, glazed.  Allover vellum glaze, crackled.  Bottom glazed.

tombstone.epitaph:
Vase, "scenic vellum", 1909.
1909. Glazed stoneware. Gift of Marcia and William Goodman. 1984-84-3.
